comments:
Hi,
I am trying to use XSD/EMF APIs in a stand alone application (not integrated 
with eclipse).
I have copied the jar files required in my lib directory 
(xsd.resources.jar,ecore.jar,xsd.jar,xercesImp.jar,xmlAPIs.jar) and added them 
to my project class path.
These jar files are part of my war file which gets deployed on weblogic.
Now when I try to execute my code written to generate XSD schema(for e.g. 
xsdSchema.getContents() or xsdSchema.getSchemaForSchema()). I get a runtime 
exception. The complete stack trace is pasted below, could you pleae let me 
know that it's a bug with Eclipse APIs or I am doing something wrong
===========================================================
Stack Trace
===========================================================

ource factory is needed

We just added support so that a "zip:" URI will be handled just like a "jar:" 
URI.  Likely there will be a build early next week to go with Eclipse RC3 and 
that build will include this fix. 

Which JDK/JRE are you using that displays this behavior?

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 67720 ***

I am using SUN JDK 1.3 and Weblogic7 SP4.
I tried the JDK provided with weblogic also jdk131_08 but the same error.
Could you please let me know which jar specifically I have to replace once your 
new build is out.

Thanks a lot.

Created an attachment (id=12508)
Jar with improved URI handling of zip: schemes.

I've attached the jar that should get you going.

Hi, Thanks for the jar file. 
But now when I copy this jar file to my lib directory then I am getting some 
compile errors. It seems that now the common.jar file is out of sync from other 
required jars. The errors which I am getting now are pasted below.
I am using a 2.0 version of other jars.

    [javac] E:\apps\eclipse\workspace\dotp\src\uk\gov\e_envoy\dotp\cma\contenten

    [javac]             sequence.getContents().add((XSDParticle)list.get(i));

It looks more like it's just not finding the jar at all.  Maybe you want to try 
getting just the URI.class out of the jar...

Hi, I extracted the URI.class file from the new common.jar and added to the old 
common.jar.It's compiling properly. But now it's throwing exception at run time.
I think now it's not able to load this class. Am I doing something wrong?
Or could you please provide me all the latest jar files of RC3.
